suppress.notes: file name: GetDocument.Insider.dll Suppressing this CVE as it is a .NetCore runtime issue affecting .NetCore runtimes below .NET Core 3.1.4 or lower. The POS Runs in an AppService which will have the fixes already applied, and the global.json has been addeded to require .NetCore 3.1.408 or greater. More details can be found here: https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/156

file name: GetDocument.Insider.dll CVE References ASP.Net versions 1.0-1.1. POS is built on ASP.Net Core 3.1+, not classic ASP.Net. See https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2005-2224 and https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/14217 for more details.
file name: GetDocument.Insider.dll Vunerability applies to AfterLogic MailBee WebMail Pro 4.1 for ASP.NET which is not used by the POS

file name: Serilog.Sinks.File:4.1.0 8117-softmagic.c in file before 5.21 does not properly limit recursion, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption or crash) via unspecified vectors. 9652-The mconvert function in softmagic.c in file before 5.21, as used in the Fileinfo component in PHP before 5.4.37, 5.5.x before 5.5.21, and 5.6.x before 5.6.5, does not properly handle a certain string-length field during a copy of a truncated version of a Pascal string, which might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory access and application crash) via a crafted file. This is a false positive. These two CVEs references a C library softmagic.c which is not used by POS

file name: Serilog.Sinks.File:5.0.0 readelf.c in file before 5.22, as used in the Fileinfo component in PHP before 5.4.37, 5.5.x before 5.5.21, and 5.6.x before 5.6.5, does not consider that pread calls sometimes read only a subset of the available data, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (uninitialized memory access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted ELF file. This is a false positive in readelf.c as POS is not using this, or PHP.

file name: Serilog.Extensions.Logging.File:2.0.0 cdf_read_property_info in cdf.c in file through 5.37 does not restrict the number of CDF_VECTOR elements, which allows a heap-based buffer overflow (4-byte out-of-bounds write) This is a false positive in cdf.c which is not used by POS

file name: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Hosting.Abstractions.dll An information disclosure vulnerability exists in .NET Framework and .NET Core which allows bypassing Cross-origin Resource Sharing (CORS) configurations, aka ".NET Framework Information Disclosure Vulnerability." This applies to version of System.Net.Http as deployed as part of .Net core below 2.1.7 or 2.2.1. POS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.408 which is not vunerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.

file name: System.Net.Http:4.3.3 See https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/111 for MS details on this CVE. Package name: System.Net.Http:4.3.3 (included as part of the .Net Core runtime) Vulnerable versions: 4.3.3 and below Secure versions: 4.3.4+ This CVE applies to .NET Core 2.1, .NET Core 1.0, .NET Core 1.1, PowerShell Core 6.0. POS is pinned to .Net core SDK > 3.1.419 which is not vulnerable, and deployed to Azure App Service which will have the security patch applied.
file name: System.Threading.Tasks.Extensions.dll Suppressing this CVE Because it relates to a mobile "Tasks" application (Astrid Tasks) version before 9.7.3. POS is not a mobile application.
file name: Azure.Storage.Blobs:12.10.0 We have upgrade to Azure.Storage.Blobs 12.16.0, this is no a false flag

file name: Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.Abstractions.dll See https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-1147 for details on this CVE. This is a temporary suppression pending a fix being available. Bug to track the fix - https://dev.azure.com/ukhydro/Abzu/_boards/board/t/Abzu%20Delivery%20Team/Stories/?workitem=58192
